page.title: 19Ancient Order of Foresters
page.content: The Frogmill has always been most popular with the local villagers of Shipton .In the early 1980's on Whit Tuesday the local branch of the Ancient Order of Foresters held their parade beginning with a service in St Oswalds ,the parish church and then marching in full regalia with flags flying,to the Frogmill Inn for dinner in the big club room.Afterwards there was all the fun of the fair.For the children,the excitement of swings, coconut shies and stalls by the roadside,and the fun of having a monkey on a stick.One of the local vicars even composed a hymn called"The Foresters Hymn"which was sung only on this occasion.The first verse began:- "Hear the call any brothers Quiet yourseves like men- Tell the word to others All be brothers then."
